description: a(0)=3 and for n>0 a(n) is the greatest prime factor of a(n-1)^2 - 2.
comments: Is this sequence unbounded? [_Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 29 2011]
links: Dennis Langdeau, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..23
author: _Yasutoshi Kohmoto_
extensions: More terms from Dennis Langdeau (dlangdea(AT)sfu.ca), Jun 26 2006
